oai:www.e-space.mmu.ac.uk:2173/24475</identifier><datestamp>2012-03-20T02:13:35Z</datestamp><setSpec>hdl_2173_663</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd" ><dc:title>Measuring phonological skills in adolescence</dc:title><dc:title>September 2006 version</dc:title><dc:creator>French, Ann</dc:creator><dc:subject>Phonological skills</dc:subject><dc:subject>Language impairment</dc:subject><dc:description>Background: Referrals of junior and secondary age children with language and communication impairments attending mainstream schools; 
Evidence that early language and communication problems may not resolve;  
Lack of secondary school SLT provision in UK;  
Lack of knowledge about the nature and extent of difficulties secondary students may encounter; 
Lack of suitable assessments.</dc:description><dc:description>Paper presented at the 6th European CPLOL Congress, 15-17 September 2006, Berlin.</dc:description><dc:date>2008-04-30T09:50:09Z</dc:date><dc:type>Presentation</dc:type><dc:identifier>http://hdl.handle.net/2173/24475</dc:identifier><dc:language>en</dc:language><dc:relation>http://www.cplol.org/eng/cplol_congress_2006_progr_en.pdf</dc:relation></oai_dc:dc></metadata></record>
